title: Ukraine agrees to accept immediate, 30-day ceasefire as US lifts aid pause
byline: Ukraine has agreed to accept a U.S. proposal for an immediate 30-day ceasefire and to take steps toward restoring a durable peace after Russia’s invasion, according to a joint U.S.-Ukraine statement on Tuesday.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that several spells of showers will occur in Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts today (12).

title: Iran’s President to Trump: I will not negotiate, ‘do whatever the hell you want’
byline: President Masoud Pezeshkian said Iran would not negotiate with the U.S. while being threatened, telling President Donald Trump to “do whatever the hell you want”, Iranian state media reported on Tuesday.

title: Accepting postal voting applications ends tonight
byline: The deadline for the accepting of applications to cast postal votes in the 2025 Local Government (LG) Elections ends at 12.00 midnight today (12).

title: GMOA launches island-wide strike over sexual assault of A’pura doctor
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to launch an island-wide strike today (12) in protest against the sexual assault of a female doctor on duty at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital.

title: 42 reservoirs overflow as heavy rains continue across the island
byline: The Department of Irrigation says that 42 out of 73 main reservoirs under its management across the country are currently being spilt as of 7.00 a.m. today (12) due to heavy rainfall.

title: More than 100 passengers rescued from Pakistan train attack
byline: Armed militants in Pakistan’s Balochistan region have attacked a train carrying more than 400 passengers and taken a number of them hostage, military sources told the BBC on Tuesday.

title: Sexual assault of A’pura Hospital doctor: Suspect arrested in Galnewa
byline: The suspect, who allegedly sexually assaulted a lady doctor at the doctors’ quarters of the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital on Monday night (10), has been arrested.

title: Sexual assault on doctor: Suspect released from prison on same day; more details emerge
byline: More details have emerged regarding the suspect, who was arrested this morning in connection with the sexual assault of a female doctor at the doctors’ quarters of the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital on Monday night (10).

title: All but one of world’s top 20 most polluted cities are in Asia, new study shows
byline: All but one of the world’s top 20 most polluted cities last year were in Asia, a new study shows.

title: Customs officer among three arrested for smuggling cigarettes worth Rs. 9 million
byline: An officer of Sri Lanka Customs and two others have been arrested by officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) for attempting to smuggle a stock of illegal cigarettes into the country.

title: GMOA to continue strike despite arrest of suspect in doctor’s sexual assault
byline: The token strike initiated by the Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) in protest of the recent sexual assault on a female doctor will continue until 8.00 a.m. tomorrow (13), despite the main suspect of the incident being arrested.

title: Scarlett Johansson very certain on never returning as Black Widow
byline: While superheroes are often thought of as invincible, Scarlett Johansson would like to remind everyone that some heroes need to have their final sendoff.

title: COPA expresses strong dissatisfaction with DMT officials for appearing unprepared
byline: The Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) has expressed strong dissatisfaction towards the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) for appearing before the committee without prior preparation.

title: Veteran actress Malini Fonseka’s health condition improves, family dismisses rumors
byline: The health condition of veteran actress Malini Fonseka, widely regarded as the ‘Queen of Sri Lankan cinema’, is showing signs of improvement, hospital sources confirmed.

title: Appeals Court to decide on Deshabandu’s petition over arrest warrant
byline: The Court of Appeal has announced that the decision on Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon’s writ petition requesting to cancel the arrest warrant issued on him by the Matara Magistrate’s Court will be delivered on March 17, 2025.

title: Notice issued on school holidays
byline: The Ministry of Education has issued an announcement regarding the end of term school holidays of all government and government-approved private schools in the year 2025.

title: CID search Sagala Ratnayaka’s office in hunt for ex-IGP Deshabandu
byline: Officers of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) have conducted a search at the office premises of former Parliamentarian Sagala Ratnayaka at Morawaka in Matara, as part of their efforts to locate former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: Police express concern over speeding, drunken driving during ‘Big Match’ vehicle parades
byline: Sri Lanka Police urges all school students, parents and old boys to enjoy the school ‘Big Match’ season in a safe and an honourable way.

title: Overseas travel ban imposed on tuition teacher accused of beating students
byline: An overseas travel ban has been imposed on a teacher at a private tuition class who is accused of forcing students to kneel and assaulting them.

title: President reviews UDA’s ongoing projects, discusses streamlining approval process for urban plans
byline: A meeting between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and officials of the Urban Development Authority (UDA) held today (12) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: 2025 LG Elections: Deadline for postal voting applications extended
byline: The Election Commission has issued a special notice to government officials, security officers, and postal vote certifying officers who wish to cast postal votes and are qualified to do so.

title: Police Sergeant arrested while soliciting bribe inside court
byline: A Police Sergeant attached to the Hatton Police Station has been arrested by the officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) for soliciting a Rs. 15,000 bribe, allegedly promising to close a court case against a couple.

title: Nearly 200 hostages rescued as Pakistan’s military battles militants who stormed passenger train
byline: Pakistan’s military have been engaged in a deadly standoff for more than 24 hours with armed militants who hijacked a train and took hostages, in a dramatic escalation of an insurgency that has plagued the region for decades.

title: Researchers create gel that can self-heal like human skin: Study
byline: Gels are commonly used products that are soft and sticky. They can be applied to hair or to the jelly-like components in various foodstuffs. While human skin shares gel-like characteristics, it has unique qualities that are very hard to replicate.

title: National Advisory Committee for SME development begins operations
byline: The National Advisory Committee, which operates with the aim of identifying problems faced by small and medium-scale entrepreneurs and providing sustainable solutions, recently launched its activities with its first session held at the Parliamentary Complex.

title: Sri Lanka revealed to be the world’s most family-friendly country for 2025
byline: There are endless things to consider when moving to another country. What is the culture like? How easy is it to find work? How are the transport links? How happy are the locals? And for families hoping to move abroad, there are even more questions – think safety, healthcare, or education systems, for example.

title: Homagama’s growing deer population to be relocated to suitable habitat
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Colombo District MP Aruna Panagoda stated in Parliament today (12) that a decision has been made to relocate the growing deer population found across several Grama Niladhari Divisions around the Homagama town area to a more suitable habitat.

title: Suspect wanted over Middeniya triple murder arrested at BIA
byline: A suspect wanted for aiding and abetting in the recent triple murder at Middeniya, has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake while trying to leave for Dubai, the police said.
